title: What's the best way to publish a script? - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t publish a script. A script is shopped, with the hope that someone purchases an option on it. That’s step one. If you’re just getting started, a good place to shop your script is through well known, and industry recognized, screenwriting contests. From there, try to get an agent interested. Meet people. The film industry is very much about who you know.

If you mean what program is the best to use to write and “publish” a script, then it is Final Draft. As for publishing to a company, just get your work out there. Print out 10 copies and carry them to movie festivals and other places like that along with sending them out to production companies.
